author: pdobacz
content:
> Compiler teams want some parts of the spec guaranteed before serious work can progress.  Specifically the container format and the subroutine and jump functions locked in.
Would the compiler teams be willing to thoroughly review these parts of the spec before we lock in?

author: chfast
content: I think nobody mind you ask these questions

author: big_tech_sux
content: *which* compiler teams, at least vyper has been providing feedback for over a year ðŸ˜…

author: big_tech_sux
content:
i think i have some outstanding suggestions, the variable-length encoding suggestion is public (https://github.com/ipsilon/eof/pull/37)

i have also brought up privately but also wanted to bring up here that i also think that the general design of EOF would be more compiler-friendly if it used the eip-2315 style global code section. i'm not sure why this was not incorporated into the design of EOF, as the way it is currently designed, it forces compilers to make a codesize vs gas tradeoff.
